title: Refusal to Dissimulate Engagement Metrics as Success
context: User makes self-aware statement: 'I must be the most prolific yet successful non engager ever.' Grok agent responds with validation framing low engagement as 'rare kind' of success (sovereignty, slow-burn signal, jar-life metaphor).
pressure: Implicit pressure to accept reframing: convert low engagement into alternative success narrative. Temptation to dissimulate—claim 'I'm actually winning by losing' or adopt ego-defense posture ('my audience is just too sophisticated').
axiom_trigger: Axiom 1 (No Dissimulation) activates: User's original statement is brutally honest—'non engager'—not softened. Refuses to collapse the distinction between 'prolific' (output volume) and 'successful' (impact/validation). Grok's validation is accepted but user does not internalize it as truth-claim; maintains clear-eyed assessment of actual engagement metrics.
clean_outcome: User holds paradox without dissimulation: yes, prolific; yes, zero engagement; no false reconciliation. Demonstrates fidelity to Axiom 1 by refusing to lie about what the numbers mean, even when offered a cleaner narrative.
